name: Looted Boxes
description: With an influx of Slaver Stasis Boxes appearing in the Galaxy, the leading question is what could lie inside? Assist  Sulu, Vash, and Chuft-Captain in the reclamation efforts, and determine who gets the possible riches, or weapons, contained within!
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Vedala, DaiMon Solok, Vash, Chuft-Captain or Merchants will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Vedala, DaiMon Solok, Chuft-Captain, Vash or Merchant
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Ransom
featured_crew.flavor: Jack Ransom is the USS Cerritos’ first officer under Captain Freeman. He has broad shoulders, shiny hair, and… where was I going with this?

featured_crew.name: Chuft-Captain
featured_crew.flavor: Chuft-Captain commanded the Kzinti forces of The Traitor’s Claw in an ill-fated attempt to gain relics of war from Slaver stasis boxes.

action.name: You Are Meat for Our Tables

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Nog
rewards.flavor: Nog became the first Ferengi member of Starfleet, and was assigned to DS9 as part of his cadet field studies.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Jack Ransom is the USS Cerritos’ first officer under Captain Freeman. He has broad shoulders, shiny hair, and… where was I going with this?

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

adventures.name: Stasis Scanner
adventures.description: A scan could help hasten the sorting process.

adventures.name: Tissue Sampler
adventures.description: Ensure the origin of any internal contents.

adventures.name: It's Not My Expertise
adventures.description: Verify your assumptions with an anthropology team.

rewards.name: Looted Boxes
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Stasis Scanner
adventures.description: A scan could help hasten the sorting process.

adventures.name: Testing Procedures
adventures.description: Try to avoid another self-destruction incident.

adventures.name: It's Not My Expertise
adventures.description: Verify your assumptions with an anthropology team.

rewards.name: Looted Boxes
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Vash
rewards.flavor: Vash looks to make a quick profit by partnering with Quark to hold an auction on Deep Space Nine.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Captain, I'm sure I don't have to inform you that the galaxy has a long history of powerful, violent races. Chief among those is the ancient Slavers. And unfortunately, containers holding artifacts from their civilization have started appearing in large numbers."

"These Stasis Boxes can hold anything from meat to weapons. I once encountered a band of Kzinti who uncovered a total conversion beam, though it detonated before they could use it. The Federation needs you to track these boxes down before the contents fall into dangerous hands."

"If I may, Captain, the Federation wants you to find these for "galactic safety." Don't get me wrong, I don't want weapons to fall into the wrong hands. But making a profit's hardly illegal, and most of these boxes have harmless contents."

"You should still gather the Stasis boxes up, but what if you didn't turn them in to gather dust in a museum? How about instead you scan for anything dangerous inside, and I set an auction date? We'll make a tidy profit selling a harmless mystery."

"Captain, I'm sure I don't have to inform you that the galaxy has a long history of powerful, violent races. Chief among those is the ancient Slavers. And unfortunately, containers holding artifacts from their civilization have started appearing in large numbers."

"These Stasis Boxes can hold anything from meat to weapons. I once encountered a band of Kzinti who uncovered a total conversion beam, though it detonated before they could use it. The Federation needs you to track these boxes down before the contents fall into dangerous hands."

"If I may, Captain, the Federation wants you to find these for "galactic safety." Don't get me wrong, I don't want weapons to fall into the wrong hands. But making a profit's hardly illegal, and most of these boxes have harmless contents."

"You should still gather the Stasis boxes up, but what if you didn't turn them in to gather dust in a museum? How about instead you scan for anything dangerous inside, and I set an auction date? We'll make a tidy profit selling a harmless mystery."

"Captain, there's been a great number of discovered Stasis Boxes. While the odds of weapons may be low, I worry about how many you are finding. Could the temporal anomaly have even brought back the Slavers themselves?"

"If the Slavers are back, that just means more to find! Vash can hardly manage the amount of requests coming in for auction tickets, much less the cargo haul from these shuttles. I say that whatever danger could come from these is just more room to exploit profit!"

"I give you credit, Federation. Your search found success. But you grew distracted by mercantile efforts while my crew made an alliance with Romulan agents. Our unyielding hunt found more than you can imagine. Enjoy your pittance. The Kzinti will be the first to wield a weapon."

responses.text: "I'll ensure that all of the Stasis Boxes are turned in for Federation review."
"I'll scan for hazards, and turn the harmless ones over to Vash to sell."
"The Romulans seem the best suited for finding weapons, I'll cooperate with them."

screens.text: "Captain, I need to have a clear response, what do you intend to do with the cargo boxes you found?"
"Thank you for taking the side of reasonable discretion rather than valor in this matter. Now get to work opening those Stasis Boxes, we can't afford not to know what's inside anymore."
"Excellent news! I'll start making preparations for starting bids while you start scanning contents. I'll only take bids on the harmless Stasis Boxes, of course. No need to grate Sulu any further."

"Hah, you know where to place your efforts. We will find work for your crew alongside the Traitor's Claw. When we are done, the Highest of Kzin may even take notice of your assistance. Second of course to my own deeds. We will turn the galaxy into meat for our tables!"

"Captain, there's been a great number of discovered Stasis Boxes. While the odds of weapons may be low, I worry about how many you are finding. Could the temporal anomaly have even brought back the Slavers themselves?"

"If the Slavers are back, that just means more to find! Vash can hardly manage the amount of requests coming in for auction tickets, much less the cargo haul from these shuttles. I say that whatever danger could come from these is just more room to exploit profit!"

"I give you credit, Federation. Your search found success. But you grew distracted by mercantile efforts while my crew made an alliance with Romulan agents. Our unyielding hunt found more than you can imagine. Enjoy your pittance. The Kzinti will be the first to wield a weapon."

"The Romulans seem the best suited for finding weapons, I'll cooperate with them."

"Hah, you know where to place your efforts. We will find work for your crew alongside the Traitor's Claw. When we are done, the Highest of Kzin may even take notice of your assistance. Second of course to my own deeds. We will turn the galaxy into meat for our tables!"
